db:abstract.db:para: The QUtf8StringView class provides a unified view on UTF-8 strings with a read-only subset of the QString API.
This class was introduced in Qt 6.0.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:abstract.db:para: This class is strongly comparable with char16_t, QChar, const char16_t *, QString, QStringView, and QLatin1StringView.
This class is strongly comparable with const char *, QByteArray, and QByteArrayView.
The contents of byte arrays is interpreted as UTF-8.

db:listitem.db:para: QUtf8StringView is part of toolsClasses for string data

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A QUtf8StringView references a contiguous portion of a UTF-8 string it does not own. It acts as an interface type to all kinds of UTF-8 string, without the need to construct a QString or QByteArray first.
The UTF-8 string may be represented as an array (or an array-compatible data-structure such as std::basic_string, etc.) of char8_t, char, signed char or unsigned char.

QUtf8StringView is designed as an interface type; its main use-case is as a function parameter type. When QUtf8StringViews are used as automatic variables or data members, care must be taken to ensure that the referenced string data (for example, owned by a std::u8string) outlives the QUtf8StringView on all code paths, lest the string view ends up referencing deleted data.

When used as an interface type, QUtf8StringView allows a single function to accept a wide variety of UTF-8 string data sources. One function accepting QUtf8StringView thus replaces several function overloads (taking e.g. QByteArray), while at the same time enabling even more string data sources to be passed to the function, such as u8"Hello World", a char8_t (C++20) or char (C++17) string literal. The char8_t incompatibility between C++17 and C++20 goes away when using QUtf8StringView.
Like all views, QUtf8StringViews should be passed by value, not by reference-to-const:
db:section.db:programlisting: void myfun1(QUtf8StringView sv); // preferred void myfun2(const QUtf8StringView &sv); // compiles and works, but slower
db:section.db:para: If you want to give your users maximum freedom in what strings they can pass to your function, consider using QAnyStringView instead.

QUtf8StringView can also be used as the return value of a function. If you call a function returning QUtf8StringView, take extra care to not keep the QUtf8StringView around longer than the function promises to keep the referenced string data alive. If in doubt, obtain a strong reference to the data by calling toString() to convert the QUtf8StringView into a QString.
QUtf8StringView is a Literal Type.

db:section.db:title: Compatible Character Types
db:section.db:para: QUtf8StringView accepts strings over a variety of character types:

db:section.db:title: Sizes and Sub-Strings
db:section.db:para: All sizes and positions in QUtf8StringView functions are in UTF-8 code points (that is, UTF-8 multibyte sequences count as two, three or four, depending on their length). QUtf8StringView does not an attempt to detect or prevent slicing right through UTF-8 multibyte sequences. This is similar to the situation with QStringView and surrogate pairs.

db:section.db:title: C++20, char8_t, and QUtf8StringView
db:section.db:para: In C++20, u8"" string literals changed their type from const char[] to const char8_t[]. If Qt 6 could have depended on C++20, QUtf8StringView would store char8_t natively, and the following functions and aliases would use (pointers to) char8_t:

This is what QUtf8StringView is expected to look like in Qt 7, but for Qt 6, this was not possible. Instead of locking users into a C++17-era interface for the next decade, Qt provides two QUtf8StringView classes, in different (inline) namespaces. The first, in namespace q_no_char8_t, has a value_type of const char and is universally available. The second, in namespace q_has_char8_t, has a value_type of const char8_t and is only available when compiling in C++20 mode.

q_no_char8_t is an inline namespace regardless of C++ edition, to avoid accidental binary incompatibilities. To use the char8_t version, you need to name it explicitly with q_has_char8_t::QUtf8StringView.
Internally, both are instantiations of the same template class, QBasicUtf8StringView. Please do not use the template class's name in your source code.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::const_iterator
db:section.db:para: This typedef provides an STL-style const iterator for QUtf8StringView.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::const_pointer
db:section.db:para: Alias for value_type *. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::const_reference
db:section.db:para: Alias for value_type &. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::const_reverse_iterator
db:section.db:para: This typedef provides an STL-style const reverse iterator for QUtf8StringView.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::difference_type
db:section.db:para: Alias for std::ptrdiff_t. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::iterator
db:section.db:para: This typedef provides an STL-style const iterator for QUtf8StringView.
QUtf8StringView does not support mutable iterators, so this is the same as const_iterator.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::pointer
db:section.db:para: Alias for value_type *. Provided for compatibility with the STL.
QUtf8StringView does not support mutable pointers, so this is the same as const_pointer.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::reference
db:section.db:para: Alias for value_type &. Provided for compatibility with the STL.
QUtf8StringView does not support mutable references, so this is the same as const_reference.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::reverse_iterator
db:section.db:para: This typedef provides an STL-style const reverse iterator for QUtf8StringView.
QUtf8StringView does not support mutable reverse iterators, so this is the same as const_reverse_iterator.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::size_type
db:section.db:para: Alias for qsizetype. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: [alias] QUtf8StringView::storage_type
db:section.db:para: Alias for char.

db:section.db:title: QUtf8StringView::value_type
db:section.db:para: Alias for const char. Provided for compatibility with the STL.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.5] int QUtf8StringView::compare(QLatin1StringView str, Qt::CaseSensitivity cs = Qt::CaseSensitive) const
db:section.db:bridgehead: [noexcept, since 6.5] int QUtf8StringView::compare(QStringView str, Qt::CaseSensitivity cs = Qt::CaseSensitive) const
[noexcept, since 6.5] int QUtf8StringView::compare(QUtf8StringView str, Qt::CaseSensitivity cs = Qt::CaseSensitive) const
db:section.db:para: Compares this string view with str and returns a negative integer if this string view is less than str, a positive integer if it is greater than str, and zero if they are equal.
If cs is Qt::CaseSensitive (the default), the comparison is case-sensitive; otherwise the comparison is case-insensitive.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QUtf8StringView::QUtf8StringView()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null string view.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QUtf8StringView::QUtf8StringView(const Char (&)[N] string)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a string view on the character string literal string. The view covers the array until the first Char(0) is encountered, or N, whichever comes first. If you need the full array, use fromArray() instead.
string must remain valid for the lifetime of this string view object.

db:section.db:title: Constraints
db:section.db:para: Participates in overload resolution only if string is an actual array and if Char is a compatible character type. The compatible character types are: char8_t, char, signed char and unsigned char.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QUtf8StringView::QUtf8StringView(const Char *str)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a string view on str. The length is determined by scanning for the first Char(0).
str must remain valid for the lifetime of this string view object.
Passing nullptr as str is safe and results in a null string view.

db:section.db:title: Constraints
db:section.db:para: Participates in overload resolution only if str is not an array and if Char is a compatible character type. The compatible character types are: char8_t, char, signed char and unsigned char.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QUtf8StringView::QUtf8StringView(const Container &str)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a string view on str. The length is taken from std::size(str).
std::data(str) must remain valid for the lifetime of this string view object.
The string view will be empty if and only if std::size(str) == 0. It is unspecified whether this constructor can result in a null string view (std::data(str) would have to return nullptr for this).

db:section.db:title: Constraints
db:section.db:para: Participates in overload resolution only if Container is a container with a compatible character type as value_type. The compatible character types are: char8_t, char, signed char and unsigned char.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QUtf8StringView::QUtf8StringView(std::nullptr_t)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null string view.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView::QUtf8StringView(const Char *first, const Char *last)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a string view on first with length (last - first).
The range [first,last) must remain valid for the lifetime of this string view object.
Passing \nullptr as first is safe if last is nullptr, too, and results in a null string view.
The behavior is undefined if last precedes first, or first is nullptr and last is not.

db:section.db:title: Constraints
db:section.db:para: Participates in overload resolution only if Char is a compatible character type. The compatible character types are: char8_t, char, signed char and unsigned char.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView::QUtf8StringView(const Char *str, qsizetype len)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a string view on str with length len.
The range [str,len) must remain valid for the lifetime of this string view object.
Passing nullptr as str is safe if len is 0, too, and results in a null string view.
The behavior is undefined if len is negative or, when positive, if str is nullptr.

db:section.db:title: Constraints
db:section.db:para: Participates in overload resolution only if Char is a compatible character type. The compatible character types are: char8_t, char, signed char and unsigned char.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.9] QString QUtf8StringView::arg(Args &&... args) const
db:section.db:para: Replaces occurrences of %N in this string with the corresponding argument from args. The arguments are not positional: the first of the args replaces the %N with the lowest N (all of them), the second of the args the %N with the next-lowest N etc.
Args can consist of anything that implicitly converts to QAnyStringView.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.9.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView::storage_type QUtf8StringView::at(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the code point at position n in this string view.
The behavior is undefined if n is negative or not less than size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView::storage_type QUtf8StringView::back() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the last code point in the string view. Same as last().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:warning.db:para: Calling this function on an empty string view constitutes undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_iterator QUtf8StringView::begin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const STL-style iterator pointing to the first code point in the string view.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_iterator QUtf8StringView::cbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Same as begin().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_iterator QUtf8StringView::cend() const
db:section.db:para: Same as end().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] void QUtf8StringView::chop(qsizetype n)
db:section.db:para: Truncates this string view by n code points.
Same as *this = first(size() - n).

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when n < 0 or n > size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::chopped(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the substring of length size() - n starting at the beginning of this object.
Same as first(size() - n).

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when n < 0 or n > size().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_reverse_iterator QUtf8StringView::crbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Same as rbegin().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_reverse_iterator QUtf8StringView::crend() const
db:section.db:para: Same as rend().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_pointer QUtf8StringView::data() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const pointer to the first code point in the string view.

db:note.db:para: The character array represented by the return value is not null-terminated.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool QUtf8StringView::empty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether this string view is empty - that is, whether size() == 0.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_iterator QUtf8StringView::end() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const STL-style iterator pointing to the imaginary code point after the last code point in the list.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::first(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string view that contains the first n code points of this string view.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when n < 0 or n > size().

db:section.db:title: [static constexpr noexcept] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::fromArray(const Char (&)[Size] string)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a string view on the full character string literal string, including any trailing Char(0). If you don't want the null-terminator included in the view then you can chop() it off when you are certain it is at the end. Alternatively you can use the constructor overload taking an array literal which will create a view up to, but not including, the first null-terminator in the data.
string must remain valid for the lifetime of this string view object.
This function will work with any array literal if Char is a compatible character type. The compatible character types are: char8_t, char, signed char and unsigned char.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView::storage_type QUtf8StringView::front() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the first code point in the string view. Same as first().
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:warning.db:para: Calling this function on an empty string view constitutes undefined behavior.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool QUtf8StringView::isEmpty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether this string view is empty - that is, whether size() == 0.
This function is provided for compatibility with other Qt containers.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool QUtf8StringView::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether this string view is null - that is, whether data() == nullptr.
This functions is provided for compatibility with other Qt containers.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.3] bool QUtf8StringView::isValidUtf8() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this string contains valid UTF-8 encoded data, or false otherwise.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::last(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string view that contains the last n code points of this string view.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when n < 0 or n > size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] qsizetype QUtf8StringView::length() const
db:section.db:para: Same as size().
This function is provided for compatibility with other Qt containers.

db:section.db:title: [static constexpr noexcept, since 6.8] qsizetype QUtf8StringView::maxSize()
db:section.db:para: It returns the maximum number of elements that the view can theoretically represent. In practice, the number can be much smaller, limited by the amount of memory available to the system.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept, since 6.8] qsizetype QUtf8StringView::max_size() const
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for STL compatibility.
Returns maxSize().
This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_reverse_iterator QUtf8StringView::rbegin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const STL-style reverse iterator pointing to the first code point in the string view, in reverse order.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QUtf8StringView::const_reverse_iterator QUtf8StringView::rend() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a STL-style reverse iterator pointing to one past the last code point in the string view, in reverse order.
This function is provided for STL compatibility.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] qsizetype QUtf8StringView::size() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the size of this string view, in UTF-8 code points (that is, multi-byte sequences count as more than one for the purposes of this function, the same as surrogate pairs in QString and QStringView).

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.8] QUtf8StringView &QUtf8StringView::slice(qsizetype pos, qsizetype n)
db:section.db:para: Modifies this string view to start at position pos, extending for n code points.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when pos < 0, n < 0, or pos + n > size().

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 6.8] QUtf8StringView &QUtf8StringView::slice(qsizetype pos)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Modifies this string view to start at position pos, extending to its end.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when pos < 0 or pos > size().

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::sliced(qsizetype pos) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string view starting at position pos in this object, and extending to its end.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when pos < 0 or pos > size().

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::sliced(qsizetype pos, qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string view containing n code points of this string view, starting at position pos.

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when pos < 0, n < 0, or pos + n > size().

db:section.db:title: QString QUtf8StringView::toString() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a deep copy of this string view's data as a QString.
The return value will be a null QString if and only if this string view is null.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] void QUtf8StringView::truncate(qsizetype n)
db:section.db:para: Truncates this string view to n code points.
Same as *this = first(n).

db:note.db:para: The behavior is undefined when n < 0 or n > size().

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] const char8_t *QUtf8StringView::utf8() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a const pointer to the first code point in the string view.
The result is returned as a const char8_t*, so this function is only available when compiling in C++20 mode.

db:note.db:para: The character array represented by the return value is not null-terminated.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.7] std::basic_string_view<QUtf8StringView::storage_type> QUtf8StringView::operator std::basic_string_view<QUtf8StringView::storage_type>() const
db:section.db:para: Converts this QUtf8StringView object to a std::basic_string_view object. The returned view will have the same data pointer and length of this view. The character type of the returned view will be storage_type.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.7.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QUtf8StringView::storage_type QUtf8StringView::operator[](qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the code point at position n in this string view.
The behavior is undefined if n is negative or not less than size().

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QUtf8StringView
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QUtf8StringView are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, deprecated] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::left(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use first() instead in new code.
Returns the substring of length n starting at position 0 in this object.
The entire string view is returned if n is greater than or equal to size(), or less than zero.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, deprecated] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::mid(qsizetype pos, qsizetype n = -1) const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Returns the substring of length n starting at position pos in this object.
Use sliced() instead in new code.

Returns an empty string view if n exceeds the length of the string view. If there are less than n code points available in the string view starting at pos, or if n is negative (default), the function returns all code points that are available from pos.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, deprecated] QUtf8StringView QUtf8StringView::right(qsizetype n) const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Use last() instead in new code.
Returns the substring of length n starting at position size() - n in this object.
The entire string view is returned if n is greater than or equal to size(), or less than zero.
